newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Celesc offers 114.8 mln reais in pfd shrs.
newsitem.headline: Celesc offers 114.8 mln reais in pfd shrs.

text.p: Brazilian power utility Celesc is offering 114.8 million reais in preferred shares on the local and international markets, the company said in a published statement.

The global offering involves a total of 140 million preferred B shares, of which 49 million shares at 0.82 real each are being offered to local investors and 910,000 of Global Depositary Shares (GDS) will be sold to foreigners, the statement said.
Each GDS represents 100 preferred B shares.
An additional lot of 21 million shares may be offered if there is heavy demand, it added.

With the stock issue, Celesc's total capital will be raised to 676.1 million reais from 561.3 million reais, it added. The funds raised with the issue will be used to finance investments to expand Celesc's generating capacity.

Based in southern Brazil, Celesc, formally known as Centrais Eletricas de Santa Catarina, is controlled by Santa Catarina state government. It serves 1.4 million customers and provides about 97 percent of the state's electricity.
The share issue is being coordinated by banks Garantia, Dresdner Kleinwort Benson and JP Morgan.
